result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Fine and court costs totaling $550.05.    If probation/extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant on behalf of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA Assessment and follow through on all recommendations of Counselor.
As a convicted felon, prohibited from possessing a firearm.
Successfully complete Cognitive Behavior therapy as directed by DOC agent.
As a convicted felon, prohibited from voting until civil rights restored.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety and no consumption of illegal drugs.  Submit to random UAs and drug testing.    Defendant is to submit DNA sample.

ADDRESS INFO for John Makoons Peterson
Current: c/o Bayfield County Jail,   (Effective: 10-04-2016)
Prior: 8225 State Hwy 13, Bayfield, WI 54814 United States
Motion to vacate ineffective assistnace of counsel filed by defendant
Email correspondence from Kay Cederberg to Public Defender office in Ashland
Exhibit 1 - 29.  Exhibit 1, 3, 7 and 27 are discs.  Exhibits 9-26 are photos and are unscanable.
Jury instructions, jury question submitted during deliberations and unsigned verdict form for not guilty

Defendant John Makoons Peterson in court with Stand-by Counsel, Vincent Kurta.   Amber Hahn, Assistant AG, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties meet with the Court outside presence of jury.  Defendant motion to dismiss; State not proven.  Hahn response; elements have been met.  Defendant response; no physical evidence shown; failed to prove the case; was not conspiring with any of the co-defendants.  Court informs Defendant of process/procedure.  Court satisfied that at this stage, a reasonable jury could find guilt or innocence; appropriate for the issue to go to the jury.  Motion to dismiss is denied.  Court questions if Defendant still intends to play the entire interview audio/video; Defendant wants to play the entire video.  Hahn responds to interview of 11-10-2014; shows which parts of the audio/video are not relevant; 10:45 to 14:12, content of this section is where Defendant is talking to Agent about the outstanding warrant; confusing for the jury and not relevent, prejudicial to the State.  Defendant wants this shown to the jury.  Court, not so confusing that it cannot be shown to the jury.  Court questions Defendant if he plans to testify, he indicates he is.  Hahn indicates other portions that are ok to show; 27:16 to 30:33, Agent is explaining "conspiracy" to the Defendant, is not exactly correct; Court wants to review it.  Court questions Hahn what portion is concerning; Hahn responds, Defendant asks this portion be played.  Court, portion will be allowed.  
11-10-2014 interview showing 1:08:00 to 1:13:28, irelevent and prejudicial to the State.  Court, conflict is for someone else to determine.  Hahn shares comments of Def. regarding DA Bourg.  Defendant asks the videos not be played.  Court, that is your choice; this portion just played is prejudicial to both sides and would not allow that section be played.  If Defendant does change his mind about playing the videos, will address any other portions at that time.
Hahn, informs the Court that Def. made comment about videos were coersion; may request curative instruction if he testifies he was coersed; feels there is a clear waiver when he declined a Goodchild Hearing, no motions filed; secondary waiver when no objection during trial.  Court questions recording of Miranda reading; Hahn responds.  Court questions if there could be coersion even with a Miranda; Hahn responds.  Court questions Defendant about plan to testify coersion; Defendant indicates no; he asks to see the Miranda from 11-07-2014 interview; exhibit #1 at 00:00 to 02:15; Defendant not going to tell the jury he was coersed.  State still resting.  Defendant asks for break before starting.  Court questions Defendant, changed his mind, not going to testify.  Court reminds him that he can make a closing argument, but only to the evidence brought in during the trial.  Court informs Defendant of process/procedure of a closing argument; Defendant will not testify; he understands right to testify or not; Court takes break for Defendant to talk w/Stand-by Counsel.  Defendant informs the Court that he has changed his mind and is going to testify.  Court informs Defendant of his rights; he has had sufficient time to talk w/Stand-by Counsel; Defendant changes mind, is not going to testify, had sufficient time to talk w/Stand-by Counsel; Court finds his decision not to testify has been made knowingly and voluntarily; understands advantages and disadvantages.  Defendant, will not call any witnesses.  Court reviews procedure with parties.  
Jury in at 9:42 a.m.  State does not have any witnesses.  Defendant does not have any witnesses.  Court informs jury that the parties will work with the Court to prepare jury instructions; allows them to take an hour break and allowed to leave if they want, asks they return by 10:45 a.m.  Hahn, requests 262 instruction include specific paragraphs re: venue under 971.19 (2) and (6); requests 1st paragraph and last paragraph of instruction.  Defendant comments.  Court, satisfied State has produced evidence to support proving elements of conspiracy.  State has suggested specifics of venue issues within instruction 262; State suggested sufficient language within this instruction.  Court suggests Def. talk w/Stand-by Counsel.  Defendant comments, wants unanimous.  Hahn, Holland case 280 NW 2nd 288, 91 Wis 2nd 294 referenced.  Defendant responds.  Court; patterned instruction appropriate, but agree w/State it is appropriate to instruct jury that they don't have to have unanimous on any one, will consider proposed language from parties on this issue.  Break taken at 10 a.m. for preparation of instructions.
10:35 a.m. Court reports to the parties, will have draft instructions very soon; 315 will be added if Defendant makes request; venue instruction is built into the subst. instruction.  
10:53 a.m. Court reviews draft instructions with parties; State no additions requested; asks to review 110, 2nd paragraph remove "City of Washburn"; Court agrees and will remove.  State requests Court language is included, final paragraph "or that the offense was completed in Bayfield County" should be added; Court informs 2nd and 3rd para of 267; new paragraph should be added before "If you are satisfied..."; the 12 jurors language is in the wrong spot, Court will change; Hahn asks to change to "upon", Court agrees.  Court asks if State is satisfied w/language describing conspiracy; State satisfied.  Defendant asks to add language to the verdict re: 50 grams, State agrees and offers specific language-Defendant disagrees; Court reviews offered language.  Hahn 961.41 (1)(e) is what Defendant is charged under; request the foreperson circle the appropriate amount, jury must make the finding of the amount; Court-this goes to the penalty, which jury has not say in; Defendant feels this would be too confusing; Court explains what information can be shared w/Jury, agrees with the State that the jury must find the amount; Court if jury finds guilt on lowest amount, or highest amount, penalty is based on the finding; informs Defendant he may want to discuss w/Stand-by Counsel.  Hahn informs Court that instruction 6001 is instruction re: quantity; Court reviews; Hahn comments on design of 6001 instruction; Court, footnote on patterned instruction read; Hahn, "more than", or "not more than" language discussed; Court discusses w/ JA of language to be used in the verdict; Defendant comments about quantity; Hahn, has to be included; Court, satisfied based on evidence that has come in that 6001 needs to be added; questions if should be added within the body of 570, or stand-alone instruction; Hahn, appropriate to add language into 570 before 267 or "intent"; Defendant wants to have 6001 as a stand-alone; Court-for clarity, will add into 570 and reads to parties; Hahn agrees w/reading; Defendant no other issues; Hahn no other issues.  Court will have these corrected/changed.  
11:56 a.m.; Court shares corrected instructions; Hahn questions 267 language, "if you are satisfied...", Court, yes, need to add this in; "or the offense was completed in Bayfield Co".  Court talk w/Defendant about 315;  Defendant asks this be included in the instructions; Court will add.  Court informs parties he has sent the jurors out for lunch; want to review the instructions with parties one-by-one.  100, 103, 110, 140, 145, 147, 148, 155, 157, 160, 170, 190, 195, 300, 315, 570, 360, 480, 515, verdict forms; Court will make the one change to "parties" in 160.  Break for lunch...back at 1 p.m.
1:02 p.m. Court checks with parties if ready to continue; Hahn requests to connect laptop; Defendant ready to proceed.  Jurors brought into the courtroom.  Jury instructions read to the jury; Closing argument of Atty Hahn; Closing argument of Defendant; Rebuttal by Atty Hahn; Court continues reading instructions to the jury, including rights of Defendant addressed by the Court.  Bailiff sworn; jury out for deliberation at 2:19 p.m.  Court discusses issues w/parties; Hahn summarizes side bar to make the record complete; Defendant comments.  Court talks w/parties about exhibits to go to the jury; Hahn requests #9-#26 go back, #5 and #6 go back to jury; Defendant has no comments; Court allow #5, #6, #9-#26 to go back to jury, COC to get these and instructions to jury.  Court informs parties if they leave the campus, leave cell #.  3:01 p.m. question received from the jury; copy of question shared with parties; question read to the parties; Hahn comments, rely on collective memory of the evidence presented; Defendant comments, answer should be no; Court agrees w/Atty Hahn, response read to the parties; Hahn no obj.  Defendant no obj.  
Jury reports they have a verdict at 4:32 p.m.  Jury brought into the courtroom; Foreperson, Jeffrey Soderlund, hands verdict to Bailiff; Court reviews and reads:  Count 1 - G, question re: amount determined to be greater than 50 grams; unanimous verdict;  Hahn requests polling of jurors; all answered this is their verdict; Jurors thanked and excused, free to talk with anyone about the case, but not required to.  Hahn, moves for the Court to accept the jury verdict.  Defendant requests post-conviction form.  Court accepts jury verdict to the single count within the information.  Defendant still wants Atty; Court to contact SPD he is requesting an Atty for sentencing; Court relieves Atty Kurta as Stand-by Counsel as of today, but may be talking to the firm re: sentencing.  Court questions if parties wish to have PSI completed;  Court orders PSI.  Court revokes bond, continue to hold w/o bond.  Hahn requests a protective order prohibiting Defendant from posting any of the evidence; Defendant does not comment; Court grants request for a protective order, Hahn to draft order.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Afternoon session, Defendant John Makoons Peterson in court with Stand-by Counsel, Vincent Kurta.  Amber L Hahn, Ass't AG, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hahn brings up writ issue w/Court regarding the next witness; requests Court cancel writ so family member can give him a ride back to Barron Co. in time for his work shift.  Court informs witness of process/procedure; Hahn offers to witness; witness understands; Court orders witness to testify re: 04-02-2015 interview.  Atty Hahn informs the Court of an additional exhibit given to Def. today; exhibit #29.
Jury brought in courtroom at 1:26 p.m.  Derrick McDaniel sworn and questioned by Atty Hahn; exhibit #7 and #8 offered by Hahn, audio recording of interview of 04-02-2015, starting at 2:52 of the recording; ending at 10:34, starting again at 12:48 to19:00; questioning continue with this witness.  Cross by Defendant.  No re-direct by Hahn.  Court excuses witness and released from subpoena.  Hahn offers exhibit #7 and #8; Court will wait for further testimony before consideration given.  
Special Agent Jay Smith sworn and questioned by Atty Hahn;  SA since 1996; recorded interview w/D.M.; exhibits #9 - #26 reviewed by witness; witness identifies exhibits as text messages between R.B. and Defendant, took these photos from phone of R.B.; had contact w/R.B. 03-17-2015; recordings of controlled purchase; Hahn wishes to retain the right to recall this witness.  Cross by Defendant.  
Detective Thorhaug sworn and questioned by Atty Hahn; LE does pay a CI for expenses; exhibit #26 reviewed and identified by witness; Hahn offers exhibit #26, Court receives w/no obj. by Defendant.  CI involved w/controlled buy; audio recording divice was used; controlled buy was completed, CI searched and reports findings; 03-17-2015 CI controlled buy from Def. in Superior, video recorded; witness identifies Defendant; Def. obj. noted by the Court.  Cross by Defendant.  No re-direct by Hahn.  Witness excused by the Court and released from subpoena.  Break taken.
Parties and Court discuss issue of witness outside presence of jury.  Defendant comments; strike witness.  Court does not see this as a violation of the Court's order re: seq. of witnesses.  
Jury brought back into courtroom.  Robert Barber sworn and questioned by Atty Hahn; witness identifies Defendant; 03-06-2015 controlled buy in Sawyer Co; search by LE, recording divice used; Defendant was w/Tisha Bellile, met up w/LE after controlled buy; had facebook contacts with Defendant, shared these with LE; witness reviews exhibits #9 - #26, identifies these exhibits, witness' phone w/messages; Hahn offers exhibits #9 - #26 and asks to be published to jury; Court rec'd exhibits #9 - #26 w/obj. of Def.; second controlled buy 03-17-2015 in Superior at Culvers with Defendant, gives details; exhibit #27 and #28 offered and request to publish to Jury, Def. obj, so noted by the Court and overruled; published to jury, starting 19:16 ending 30:00; questioning of the witness continues w/ Hahn; recognized own voice, saw Defendant on the video, went to Super One Foods.  Cross by Defendant; tells Defendant why he worked w/LE; have 11 prior convictions.  Re-direct by Hahn.  Re-cross by Defendant.  Witness excused by the Court and released from subpoena.  Break for 10 min.
Jury brought in at 3:29 p.m.  State recalls Special Agent Jay Smith; Court reminds him he is still under oath; witness questioned by Atty Hahn; witness discloses professional career history; 10-2014 through 10-2015, participated in attempted controlled buy in Douglas Co. and discribes details of this attempted controlled buy; L.G. in back seat of vehicle and as they passed Agent, made eye contact with L.G., he knew Agent; controlled buy was not successful; R.G. fronted $, but they did not return; 11-10-2014 was present during interview w/Defendant; know R.B. as CI; Def. obj., Court notes and overrules; location of controlled buy changed; Def. was with Ms. Bellile on 2nd attempted controlled buy; witness reviews exhibits #9 - #26; exhibit #16 date is 02-26-2015; witness took these photos; witness reviews controlled buy report prepared by Invest. Thorhaug, refreshed recollection of date 03-06-2015 of controlled buy w/Ms. Bellile; witness reviewed report he authored, refreshed recollection of date 02-27-2015 as the date took photos of text messages; 03-17-2015 controlled buy in Superior with R.B. and Defendant; recites details of controlled buy; Def. obj., Court notes and overrules.  Cross by Defendant.  No re-direct by Hahn.  Witness excused by the Court and released from subpoena.  Atty Hahn offers exhibits #7, #8, #27 and #28; Court receives w/no obj.  State rests.
Court excuses jurors for the day.  Asks they return at 8:50 a.m. tomorrow.
Atty Hahn informs the Court the full recordings would not be appropriate for the jury to hear.  Court asks Atty Hahn to mark these so the Court can review in the morning.  Defendant there is nothing in the recordings that jury should not see.  Atty Hahn responds; total video is 3 h, 15 m;  Court will convene at 8:15 a.m. and go over those portions the State feels could be prejudicial.  Hahn requests if the recording is played, to have the start/stop times list.  Court informs Defendant about right to testify, or not; informs of process/procedure if he does testify; Defendant understands.  Atty Hahn asks clarification of objection during Defendant does testify; Court clarifies.  Defendant informs Court he may not need his witness to testify.  Court informs parties he will have the first draft of jury instructions ready in the morning; conference after all evidence is in.  Court stands adjourned.

Morning session on this date.  Defendant John Makoons Peterson in court with Stand-by Counsel, Vincent Kurta.   Amber Hahn, Assistant AG, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties and Court conference at 8:15 a.m.  Court makes record of Defendant using ctroom computer last night; off the record discussion with Defendant; Atty Hahn reported she and Agent Catchka did work on the computer for Mr. Peterson, neither had personal contact with Defendant;  Defendant reported he was able to view the discs and evidence on the discs; Court informs the Defendant on process/procedures; Defendant indicates he does understand.  Court informs parties the jurors are asking to bring water into the courtroom; he has approved.
Atty Hahn reports she will have 4 witnesses today with priors; R.G., # of priors is 5, Defendant agrees, Court indicates priors on R.G. is 5; L.G. # of priors is 13, Defendant agrees, Court indicates priors on L.G. is 13.  Hahn reports 2 witnesses are in custody, jail staff will bring them over but may need jury to be removed to deal with transition of witness.  L.G. may need hearing outside presence of jury.  These 2 witnesses are scheduled for around noon today.
Defendant informs the Court he would like the full interview played; Court informs Defendant of process/procedure; Hahn informs the Court; Defendant indicates he understands.  Court informs Defendant as to witness procedure; Defendant indicates he understands.
Jury brought into the courtroom at 8:28 a.m.  Gerald Catchka recalled to the witness stand and reminded he is still under oath.  Atty Hahn continues questioning witness; 11-07-2014 interviewed Mr. Peterson with Ass't Chief Kyle Cadotte, interview was recorded; Hahn offers exhibit #1, requests this be published to jury.  Interview recording played for the jury.  Atty Hahn continues questioning of witness; before interview with Defendant did read him his Miranda rights; audio recording of 11-10-2014 interview w/Defendant; Atty Hahn asks Court receive exhibits #1 and #2 and offers exhibits #3 and #4; Court receives exhibits #1 and #2 w/no obj. from Defendant; exhibit #3 played for the jury; Hahn continued questioning witness; 11-10-2014 interview was done with Ass't Chief Kyle Cadotte and Special Agent Jay Smith; Exhibit #5 presented to witness, identified by witness; Hahn offers exhibit #5 and requests publish to jury; Court rec'd w/ no obj by Defendant.  Break taken at 9:48 a.m.  Back in at 10:00 a.m.  Atty Hahn offers exhibit #6 and requests publish to the jury; Court rec'd w/no obj by Defendant.  Atty Hahn continues questioning of witness.  Court rec'd exhibits #3 and #4.  Cross examination of Witness by Defendant.  Re-direct by Atty Hahn.  Witness excused by the Court.
Robert Gokee sworn and questioned by Atty Hahn; Witness identifies Defendant.  Cross examination of Witness by Defendant.  Jurors excused; parties talk w/the Court about a police report re: statement made by witness that Def. is trying to to refresh witness recollection; Hahn responds; Court asks this happen outside of jury presence.  Jury brought back into the courtroom; Defendant continues to question witness.  Re-direct by Atty Hahn.  No Re-cross by Defendant.  Court excuses witness and released from subpoena.  
Chief of Red Cliff P.D. William Mertig sworn and questioned by Atty Hahn; worked over 25 years in law enforcement; witness identifies Defendant; describes traffic stop when Defendant was taken into custody.  Cross by Defendant; search warrant was initiated on 11-06-2014.  No re-direct by Hahn.  Court excuses witness and releases from subpoena.
Kyle Cadotte sworn and questioned by Atty Hahn; at the time of 11-05-2014 was Ass't Chief for R.C.P.D.; initiated search warrant on 11-06-2014, search warrant was issued; Witness identifies Defendant; room 306 was rented in the name of John Peterson; recites items found in the room.  Cross by Defendant; knew there was an active warrant for John Peterson when applied for search warrant; search warrant and arrest warrant were not related to each other.  Re-direct by Atty Hahn; was present during the interviews of Defendant on 2 different days.  No Re-Cross by Defendant.  Witness is excused by the Court and released from subpoena.  Break taken to arrange for next witness.  
Lance Gordon sworn and questioned by Atty Hahn; witness identifies Defendant; witness examines exhibit #6; describes purchases made.  Jurors excused for Court and parties to discuss 5th amendment rights; Hahn reports to the Court status of prosecution of this witness; Witness reports he has not talked with attorney about this issue; Hahn offers to the witness; Court reviews stats; 
Hahn requests Court compel testimony of this witness; Court informs witness, orders witness testify.  Jury brought back into the courtroom.  Questioning continued by Atty Hahn.  Cross by Defendant; questioning obj. by Atty Hahn, jury removed from the courtroom; Hahn recites 904.04 motion, allowable for Def. to question based on exhibit, but cannot state facts; Court informs Defendant; Defendant understands; Hahn suggests Defendant talk w/Stand-by Counsel; Defendant understands; Obj. sustained.  Jury brought back into the courtroom.  Questioning of witness continues by Defendant.  Re-direct by Hahn; have been interviewed several times by Special Agenty Catchka.  No re-cross by Defendant.  Witness is excused by the Court and release from subpoena.  Break taken for lunch at 12:07 p.m., jurors asked to be back at 1:10 p.m.
Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges
Voir Dire List

Defendant John Makoons Peterson in court with Stand-by Atty, Vincent Kurta.  Amber L Hahn, Ass't AG, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury selection began at 1:20 p.m.; Panel sworn.  Side bar by parties and Judge.  20 jurors called up for voir dire by the Court.  Preliminary Instruction and case information read to the jurors.  Juror #149 questioned outside presence of jurors; Court excuses him.  Atty Hahn questions jurors.  Defendant questions jurors.  Parties take strikes.  Striken jurors named; excused by the Court.  Court excuses all jurors not chosen.  Panel of 12 to serve on this case are sworn.  Pre-trial instructions given to the jurors.  Break taken at 2:50 p.m. for jurors.
Atty Hahn put on record contact between juror #987 and one of the witnesses.  Defendant agrees with comments.  Court, #987 is not serving on this case.  
Atty Hahn questions Defendant if he has had sufficient time to review videos.  Defendant needs more time; not sure if computer in jail will work with discs.  Court questions Captain Haiden about computer availability for Defendant.  Captain will work it out, if he needs to come back into the ctroom, will contact custodial staff after hours.  Atty Hahn asked Defendant if he has reviewed items on the discs and if he needs anything further; Defendant responds that he does not need anything further.  Break taken at 2:57 p.m.  
Jurors brought back in at 3:09 p.m.  Opening statement of Atty Hahn.  Opening statement of Defendant.  
Special Agent Gerald Catchka sworn and questioned by Atty Hahn.  Witness shares professional credentials.  Witness identifies Defendant.  Atty Hahn indicates to the Court she has finished questioning at this time.  Court informs jurors we are finished for the day.  Asks they be here by 8:15 a.m. tomorrow to start early.  Reminds witness he remains under oath and not free to discuss testimony with anyone.  Court informs jurors they are not to talk with anyone about the case.  Jurors excused at 3:45 p.m.
Court talks w/ Defendant and Captain Haiden about computer usage.  Court asks Defendant be brought in at 8 a.m. tomorrow.

Defendant John Makoons Peterson in court, pro se'.  Court-Appointed Stand-By Counsel, Vincent Kurta in court.  Assistant AG, Amber L Hahn, appeared for the State of Wisconsin with her Agent, Jerry Katchka.  SPD has not notified Court of Atty appointment; defendant indicates he has not heard anything from SPD.  Court informs everyone of the issue regarding Court-App't Stand-By Counsel.  Court reviews motions with parties; Hahn indicates all motions are rec'd by the State, ready to proceed on motions.  Defendant indicates all motions are rec'd by the Defendant, ready to proceed on motions.  Court informs Defendant of the need for him to let Court know if he wants to consult with Stand-By Counsel; Defendant agrees.  Court addresses issue that Defendant did not get chance to go to the law library; Hahn responds; Def. agrees he has had access to what he needs and ready to proceed.  Court informs parties that jurors will be reporting at 12:30 p.m.; informs process for jury orientation, verified parties have the most recent voir dire list.
09-12-2016 motion of defendant:  Motion to dismiss and suppress testimony.  Court has reviewed this motion; Agent Katchka lied to the court; page 17, line 25; page 18, line 1 and 2 of the transcript of prelim.  Hahn indicates he has not rec'd copy; COC printed and gave to her.  Hahn indicates that Defendant's pages and lines are not Katchka's testimony, but were the questions of the defense attorney. Court informs Defendant.  Defendant; reference to complaint, page 8.  Hahn responds; inaccuracy in complaint under letter B; technical defect, complaint is not evidence.  Court informs Defendant.  Defendant proceeds with motion; State's witnesses listed; unknown to defendant.  Hahn responds; relevence, should allow witnesses; Court informs Defendant; Hahn addresses venue issue, 971.19 and subsections applies; suggests using 267 jury instruction; Defendant has no comment; Court informs Defendant.  #1 and #2 of motion denied.
Defendant's Motion for Additional Disclosure; request for personnel records filed 09-12-2016; Defendant explains why he feels this information is needed; Hahn responds, not sufficient facts shown; offer of proof given; Court informs Defendant-request denied.  Defendant's Jay Smith request for personnel records; Defendant explains why he feels this information is needed; Hahn responds, offer of proof given; no such Gigglio evidence exists; Court denies request.  Defendant's Discovery Request; Hahn responds; offer of proof given; State's evidence for this case was shared; Defendant responds; Hahn responds; Break taken for Hahn to review discs given to Defendant from the State; 
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss filed 09-12-2016; #1 portion of this motion already dealt with this; #2 of this motion dealt with this portion; #3 of this motion dealing with now-Defendant indicates paper evidence missing; Hahn responds; State burns new CD for Defendant of evidence.  Hahn explains what happened during Court's break and evidence included on the new disc; Defendant comments.  Court-authorize Defendant to use courtroom computer while courtroom is available this morning; Hahn offered to work with him re: evidence.  Motion #4 issue; Defendant explains to the Court; Hahn responds, questions if he is challenging interview; Defendant responds.  Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail; already addressed.  
Defendant's 09-19-2016 Motion; #1 of motion 904.03; Defendant responds-already dealt with; #2 of motion 904.04, Hahn responds-no evidence under this stats.; Court explains to Defendant.  #3 of motion; request for map of Bayfield County; Hahn responds; Court explains to Defendant.  Defendant indicates have covered all issues within the motions.  Hahn requests to address Defendant's Witness List; questions if he cannot produce an address, Defendant gives Hahn the DOB of witness in question, address unknown; Hahn comments.
State's Motion in Limine; Seq of Witnesses; Hahn comments; Requests Agent Katchka remain as State's Agent-Court grants request for Agent; Defendant understands; Court reviews process of seq. of witnesses-grants motion.  #3 of State's Motion-Opening and Closing Statements and telling of facts; Defendant understands; Court informs the Defendant of process.  #4 of State's Motion; penalty and degree of offense and negotiations-Hahn comments; Defendant responds and understands; Court informs the Defendant of process.  #6 of State's Motion-history of convictions; Hahn comments; Defendant responds; # of priors is 15-review priors with Court; Court informs the Defendant; Defendant agrees to # being 14; Court directs # of priors is 14 if Defendant does testify.  Hahn reports to # of priors on R.B. would be 9; Defendant comments; Court agrees with Defendant, # of priors on R.B. would be 11.  Hahn reports to # of priors on D.M. would be 12; Defendant comments; Court # of priors on D.M. is 12.  Hahn reports that L.G. also has priors, will get figure to the Court before end of day.  Hahn preclude statements; Court informs Defendant-grants motion. Hahn comments on Defendant's comments; Defendant understands; Court grants.  #9 Hahn comments on Defendant's comments on bad acts; Defendant understands-Court grants motion.  #11, Hahn comments on questioning of witnesses priors and inappropriate questioning and impeachment of witnesses; Defendant understands, brings up UAs or questioning if under influence; Hahn comments; Court informs Defendant-grants motion.  #12 States Motion, Hahn comments re: conduct during trial; Court comments about access to witnesses; Defendant agrees; Court informs parties of Court's ruling.  #13 of State's Motion; Hahn comments re: conduct during trial; Defendant no comments; Court informs parties of Court's ruling.  Hahn comments about video interviews, cut out specific clips to be shown and have given list of original times of these clips to Defendant; Defendant indicates no concerns; Court questions if transcription of audio prepared, Hahn responds; Court questions how State wants to proceed with the record on audio recordings; Hahn responds; Defendant agrees; Court will leave this issue up to the court reporter's decision if she can prepare based on quality of recording.  
Hahn questions how Court wishes to proceed with witnesses today; Court responds.  Defendant indicates he has not other issues to be addressed and is ready to proceed.  Atty Kurta indicates he does not have any issues to bring to the Court at this time.  Court directs jail staff how he is to be brought into the courtroom.  Stand adjourned at 10:35 a.m.

Defendant John Makoons Peterson in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant John Makoons Peterson in custody.  Frederick Ian Bourg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant wants to go forward with preliminary hearing.  DA calls Special Agent Gerald Katchka.  Sworn and testifies.  Exhibit # 1 marked.  Witness identifies document.  DA moves for admission.  No objection.  Exhibit #1 received.  Direct continues. Cross by Atty. Richards.  Argument by DA.  Argument by Atty. Richards.  Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial.  DA files information.  Atty. Richard waives formal reading and enters not guilty plea and demands speedy trial.  DA asserts that speedy trial must be demanded by all co-defendants.  Court enlarges timeframes to file motions regarding severance and speedy trial or any other pretrial motions.  Court gives defense 20 days to file motions.  Court accepts plea.  Atty.  Richards argues bond modification.  Asks for a $10,000 signature bond or $500 cash.  Argument by DA.  Argument by Richards.  Court denies motion to modify bond.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 11, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
